question: hello
answer: Hello! Thanks for visiting my portfolio. Feel free to ask me about my projects, experience or contact details.

question: hi
answer: Hello! Thanks for visiting my portfolio. Feel free to ask me about my projects, experience or contact details.

question: tell me about umme
answer: Umme Athiya is an AI/ML engineer based in Chicago with over five years of experience. She specialises in large language models, generative AI and building scalable ML systems.

question: what is llm
answer: LLM stands for Large Language Model – a type of neural network trained on vast amounts of text to understand and generate human-like language.

question: what projects have you worked on
answer: Some of my highlighted projects include SmartSign (ASL to text translation), RAGflix (movie scene retrieval using language models), ResumeRadar (resume assistant with OCR), DeepArt (neural style transfer) and SentimentScope (real-time sentiment dashboard).

question: how can i contact you
answer: You can get in touch via email (uathiya4@gmail.com), my personal website (ummeathiya.com), LinkedIn or GitHub – links are provided in the contact section.

question: where did you study
answer: I earned my M.S. in Computer Science (AI) from DePaul University in Chicago and my B.E. in Information Science from Don Bosco Institute of Technology.

question: what are your skills
answer: I work with Python, Java, C++, SQL, generative AI libraries, PyTorch, TensorFlow, MLflow, Docker, Kubernetes and many other tools. You can explore the Skills section for more details.

question: what experience do you have
answer: I have worked as an AI/ML Engineer at IBM and ImpacterAI, and as a Research & Teaching Assistant at DePaul University. My work includes deploying ML pipelines, optimizing inference systems, and developing generative AI solutions.

question: what kind of roles are you looking for
answer: I am seeking AI/ML Engineer or Research Engineer roles focused on LLMs, generative AI, real-time inference systems, and MLOps in production environments.

question: what are you working on right now
answer: I’m currently working on projects involving autonomous AI agents, hybrid ML models for sales intelligence, and improving deployment pipelines with CI/CD and monitoring.

question: have you published any research
answer: Yes, I have co-authored research papers in forecasting, NLP, and multimodal AI, published in Springer and other international journals.

question: what are your strengths
answer: I combine research knowledge with practical engineering – I can quickly prototype new ML ideas and also scale them into production systems with strong MLOps practices.

question: do you mentor or teach
answer: Yes, I mentored undergraduates as a Teaching Assistant for Python at DePaul and guided students in advanced machine learning projects and debugging.

question: what inspired you to get into AI
answer: I’ve always been fascinated by how machines can learn patterns from data. My curiosity about combining math with real-world applications pushed me into AI and machine learning.

question: which project are you most proud of
answer: I’m especially proud of SmartSign, my real-time sign language to text translator. It combines computer vision, sequence modeling and accessibility – making AI impactful in daily life.

question: do you enjoy research or engineering more
answer: Honestly, both! I enjoy exploring new ideas through research but I equally love turning them into scalable, real-world systems that people actually use.

question: what tools do you use daily
answer: Mostly Python, PyTorch, VS Code, GitHub, Docker, and cloud platforms like AWS or Azure. For experimentation I rely a lot on MLflow and Jupyter notebooks.

question: what are your hobbies
answer: Outside tech, I enjoy photography, reading about science, exploring new cuisines, and long evening walks around Chicago.

question: what is your career goal
answer: My long-term goal is to lead AI initiatives that bridge research and real-world engineering, especially in areas like generative AI, personalization, and autonomous systems.

question: do you collaborate on open source
answer: Yes! I have mentored in open source programs like Script Winter of Code and contributed to machine learning projects in the community.

question: what is your visa status
answer: I am on F-1 OPT with three years of work authorization in the U.S. and open to full-time roles.

question: are you open to relocation
answer: Yes, I am open to relocation within the U.S. for the right opportunity.

question: what industries have you worked in
answer: I’ve worked in robotics, cloud computing, healthcare AI, and enterprise SaaS platforms. My projects range from real-time fraud detection to autonomous AI agents.

question: what is your expected salary
answer: I am open to discussing compensation based on role, location, and responsibilities. Typically, my target range aligns with industry standards for AI/ML Engineer roles.

question: how many years of experience do you have
answer: I have over six years of combined experience in AI/ML engineering, research, and teaching.

question: what makes you different
answer: I blend strong research depth with hands-on engineering. I’ve built systems that don’t just stay in papers but actually scale in production – from CUDA-optimized models to multi-agent LLM orchestration.
